title: ADNOC CEO: $11 trillion investment needed to meet future global energy demand
text:
FILE PHOTO: Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber, UAE Minister of State and the Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) Group CEO, addresses a gathering during the India Energy Forum in New Delhi, India, October 15, 2018. REUTERS/Adnan Abidi

ABU DHABI (Reuters) - The chief executive of Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) said on Monday that the long-term outlook for energy demand was “robust” and that investment of $11 trillion in oil and gas was needed to keep up with projected demand.

United Arab Emirates minister of state and ADNOC Group CEO Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber also told an energy conference in Abu Dhabi that the state oil company was on track to raise oil production capacity to 4 million barrels per day by 2020 and 5 million bpd by 2030.
